item.title: Report E-2024090078
item.description:
Report E-2024090078

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-05
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that due to a nail puncture, approximately 1-gallon of Hydrochloric Acid 9% (hazardous - UN1789) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. The terminal advised they already cleaned and contained the release. The released product, damaged pail, and oil-dri was placed into a 20-gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report E-2024090061
item.description:
Report E-2024090061

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-30
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-BIN notified ERTS of a cargo release. ERTS dispatched a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. The contractor arrived on-site and confirmed approximately 1 cup of product were released affecting a 1’x1’ area of the trailer floor. The contractor collected and containerized the NOROX® DCP-40CC & -40BKC organic peroxide and all clean-up debris into one (1) 95-gallon drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024080770
item.description:
Report E-2024080770

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-04T09:14:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately ten (10) gallons of material released from ten (10) metal cans due to improperly secured freight. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area and containerized the cleanup debris into one (1) 75-gallon poly drum along with the damaged cans, impacted freight and spent absorbents. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080773
item.description:
Report E-2024080773

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-04T09:14:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-27
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) quart of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to improper loading. The released material impacted the concrete terminal floor. Dayton Freight cleaned the impacted area and containerized into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum. the generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080758
item.description:
Report E-2024080758

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-04T09:14:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-17
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to inadequate loading securement that impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area and containerized the cleanup debris into one (1) 20-gallon metal drum along with the damaged pail. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080754
item.description:
Report E-2024080754

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-04T09:14:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-08
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pail that impacted the concrete terminal floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area with absorbents and containerized the spent material into one (1) 20-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
